AL.warning-text: In order to vote absentee in Alabama, you need to return with your ballot a photocopy of an approved photo ID. A list of valid IDs can be found at https://sos.alabama.gov/alabama-votes/photo-voter-id/valid-ids

MI.warning-text: Residents who register to vote via mail must vote in person in the first election they participate in.

MN.warning-text: To complete their absentee ballot, residents must have the signature of a notary or witness who is registered to vote in Minnesota.

TN.warning-text: Residents who register to vote via mail must vote in person in the first election they participate in.

WY.warning-text: Wyoming residents living out of state can only register to vote by mail. Youâ€™ll need a notary public to witness your registration; check your local library or UPS Store to set up an appointment.

KS.warning-text: In order to vote absentee in Kansas, you need to return with your absentee ballot application a photocopy of an approved photo ID. A list of valid IDs can be found at http://www.gotvoterid.com/valid-photo-ids.html#idlist

ND.warning-text: In order to vote absentee in North Dakota, you need to return with your absentee ballot application a photocopy of an approved North Dakota ID, or get a signature from a North Dakota resident who has an approved ID. A list of valid IDs can be found at https://vip.sos.nd.gov/idrequirements.aspx

WI.warning-text: The first time you vote absentee in Wisconsin, you need to return with your absentee ballot application a photocopy of an approved Wisconsin or federal photo ID. A list of valid IDs can be found at https://www.bringitwisconsin.com/do-i-have-right-photo-id. You are also subject to this requirement each time you change your registration name or address.
